page.title: 07Corringham - an overview
page.content: Corringham is a lineated settlement on flat land. It has over 500 buildings. The buildings such as the Becket Arms, and the garage are situated on the A631 road, whilst other buildings such as the butchers shop, post office (general store), primary school, church, chapel, and playing fields are spread along the High Street,which runs northwards. Most of the houses are supplied with electricity which is the only light and power source in the village. The people of Corringham are very friendly and helpful. The village is kept very tidy and the gardens are attractive. The village organisations are the Womens Institute and a youth club.
